a slow, powerful buffalo, Bubalus bubalis, native to South Asia, Malaya, and the Philippine Islands, having a pair of large, strong horns growing from the sides of the head, domesticated and reared for milk and used as a draft animal; ಻ she-buffalo.

(proverbial analogy) like providing comfort to a lazy person, which would further slow down the work being done by him or her; ಎಮ್ಮೆಗೆ ಎರಡು ಕೊಂಬಾದರೆ, ಹೆಮ್ಮೆಗೆ ಎಂಟು ಕೋಡು emmege eraḍu kombādare, hemmege eṇṭu kōḍu (prov.) haughtiness is more offensive than the spear; ಎಮ್ಮೆಯ ಉಚ್ಚೆ ಇರುವೆಗೆ ಜಲಪ್ರಳಯ emmeya ucce iruvege jalapraḷaya (prov.) even petty difficulties may be disastrous for fragile persons.

ಎರಡನಾಡು eraḍanāḍu to go back on one's words; to change one's words, stance, view etc.; ಎರಡಕ್ಕೆ ಹೋಗು eraḍakke hōgu (sl.)to go to pass faeces; ಎರಡಿಡು eraḍidu to part into two groups; to divide (oneself) into two parts; ಎರಡು ಜೀವದವಳು eraḍu jīvadavaḷu a woman having (an) offspring developing in the uterus; a pregnant woman; ಎರಡುತಲೆ ಹಾವು eraḍu tale hāvu the non-venomous snake, Tortrix cylindrophis rufus, a short tailed earth snake with a depressed rounded head not distinct from the neck and a tail very short, conical an smooth at the end; 2. (fig.) a person secretly acting simultaneously for two opposite parties; ಎರಡು ನಾಲಗೆ eraḍu nālage a speech or word uttered with an intention of cheating; a deliberate false statement; ಎರಡು ನಾಲಗೆಯವ eraḍu nālageyava he who intentionally makes deceitful statements; a lier; ಎರಡು ಬಗೆ eraḍu bage to betray; to be treacherous; to cheat; to breach the trust; ಎರಡುಮನಸ್ಸು eraḍu manassu the state of indecision; uncertainty; ಎರಡು ಮಾತು eraḍu mātu changed opinion; second opinion; 2. ambiguous words intended to cheat; ಎರಡೆಣಿಸು eraḍeṇisu = ಎರಡುಬಗೆ; ಎರಡು ದಾಸರಿಗೆ ನಂಬಿ ಕುರುಡದಾಸ ಕೆಟ್ಟ eraḍu dāsarige nambi kuruda dāsa keṭṭa (prov.) you run after two hares, you will catch neither; ಎರಡು ಹೊಲ ಕಾದ ಹೊಲತಿ ಕೆಟ್ಟಳು eraḍu hola kāda holati keṭṭaḷu (prov.) = ಎರಡು ದಾಸರಿಗೆ ನಂಬಿ ಕುರುಡದಾಸ ಕೆಟ್ಟ; ಎರಡು ಮುಷ್ಟಿ eraḍu muṣṭi the plant Rourea santaloides of Connaraceae family; ಎರಡೂ ಕೈ ಸೇರಿದರೆ ಚಪ್ಪಾಳೆ eraḍū kai sēridare cappāḷe unity achieves, while faction fails; clapping with only one hand will not produce a noise; 2. it takes two to quarrel, to have sex, etc.

a fault, flaw, blemish or lack of something that renders something incomplete.
the state of being different or the quality that makes two things different from each other; difference; lack of similarity, equality or oneness.

ಎರವುತರು eravu taru to bring something for temporary use with a promise to return after a specific period; to bring or take a loan; ಎರವು ತೆಱು eravu teṛu to give something on loan; ಎರವಾಗು eravāgu to be distanced from; to go away from; 2. to become a hostile or enemy; ಎರವಿನ ಸಿರಿ eravina siri the wealth, jewelry or property which one possesses but does not own; ಎರವು ಕೊಡು eravu koḍu to let another person use or have (a thing) temporarily and on condition that it or the equivalent, be returned; to lend; to loan; ಎರವು ಬೇಡು eravu bēḍu to seek, request for a loan; ಎರವು ಸಿರಿಯಲ್ಲ, ಬಾವು ಡೊಳ್ಳಲ್ಲ, ನೆರೆಮನೆಯವಳ ಗಂಡ ಭಾವನಲ್ಲ eravu siriyalla, bāvuḍoḷḷalla, neremaneyavaḷa gaṇḍa bhāvanalla (prov.) borrowed wealth does not make you a rich man; ಎರವಿನವರು ಎರವು ಕಸಿದುಕೊಂಡರೆ ಕೆರವಿನಹಾಗೆ ಮೋರೆಯಾಯಿತು eravinavaru eravu kasidukoṇḍare keravinahāge mōreyāyitu (prov.) if every bird takes its own feathers you will be naked; ಎರವಿನ ಚಿನ್ನ ಧರಿಸಿ ತಾನು ಅರಸಿಯೆಂದಳು eravina cinna dharisi tānu arasiyendaḷu (prov.) a king on the stage assumes himself the king of the land.
= ಎರುಗು.
to see, perceive the difference between.
= ಎರವು ಬೇಡು (see under ಎರವು).
the plant Cassia sophera of Caesalpiniaceae family.
= ಎರಸು.
(dial.) to shut a door slightly; to half-shut a door.
any of a group of swift, bovid ruminants usu. living in wild herds on the plains of Africa and Asia; an antelope.
= ಎರಳೆಗಣ್.
= ಎರಲೆಗುಱುಪ.
an eye resembling the eyes of an antelope.
= ಎರಲೆಗುಱುಪ.
a net used to catch antelopes and deers.
a mythological bird supposed to have two heads.
(now chiefly in comp.) the cardinal number two; 2.
the deciduous tree Tetrameles nudiflora of Datiscaceae family; the false hemp tree.
a variety of large, long-legged kite, Eupoditis edwardii of Otididae family; the Indian bustard.
to become an integrated whole.
= ಎರುಗು.
the vine Cardiospermum halicacabum of Sapindaceae family; balloon vine.
a variety in the rhythmic beating in keeping time in Yakṣagāna, (a system of dance-drama of coastal districts of Karnāṭaka).
a rāga musical mode of Karnāṭaka system, that has five and seven notes in ascending and descending orders respectively, and derived from the main mode Harikāmbhoji.

(dial.) any of black, brown or red hymenopteran insects of Formicidae family, gen. wingless, that live in colonies with a complex division of labor by castes, including workers, males, and a queen; an ant.
